summary.body: In case anyone didn't get today's junk mailing inside the "City Resident" magazine, the St Alphage House redevelopment is to be exhibited at the City of London Girls School, Weds 26th March 6pm - 8pm and Thurs 27th March 4pm - 7pm. summary.body: The City of London School for Girls has a planning application in with the City to replace the grass playing surface below Thomas More and Mountjoy with an all weather synthetic surface.  The application admits that local residents may notice the 'loss of the "feel" of a real grass area'. To mitigate this, the school proposes to relandscape the surrrounding planters so as to enhance biodiversity, including planting native shrubs which will encourage birds and butterflies.   What do we think about this and why haven't we been asked to comment? What does the 'real' feel like?  I'm concerned that we might get some hideous bright green fake sward (or purple, or blue, or brown). The improved planting and maintenance propsed in the biodiversity report sounds good, but I wonder whether this is a proposed simply to placate opposition. It would be better to have the enhanced biodiversity planting and the feel of real grass.
summary.subject: Playing Field at City of London School for Girls

summary.body: As I remember, when the Girls School was getting permission to replace the grass on their playing surface with a synthetic all-weather surface, one of the blandishments tossed up to nearby residents was that the planting around the field would be renovated. There's a strip of planters along the southern edge, and a larger, wilder section above the playing surface on the northern side (with numerous lost tennis balls amongst the wild flowers and shrubbery).  I can't see that any new landscaping has happened, especially on the planters on the southern side. I realize that I should be asking the CoL School about this, but before I do, I wonder if anyone has any inside news, or better ideas? (ps: Tuesday nights seems to be football night for a bunch of large hairy men, who play seven a side football on the all weather surface. I've no problem with that, but I'm surprised that a girl's school can furnish a team for a competition like that).
summary.subject: Gardening around CoL Girls School all weather play surface
